means: 反对的，相反的，颠倒的，背面的，里面的

sentence.Network_en: Instead of complaining about what's wrong, be grateful for what's right.
sentence.Network_cn: 别抱怨不好的事，要对好的事心存感恩。

sentence.Network_en: It would be wrong to continue out of perversity.
sentence.Network_cn: 为了故意作对而继续这样做是不对的。

sentence.Network_en: One or other of the two women was wrong.
sentence.Network_cn: 这两个女人当中有一个人错了。

PerfectNetExp.abs: 小学英语反义词大全 ... left 左边（的） wrong 错误的 dangerous 危险的.
冤枉某人错误(wrong)句式归纳_词汇用法_优习英语网 ...I don’t think he is in the wrong. 我认为他没错。.
...natural right（自然正当），那当然绝对地只有一个right andwrong（对和错）的标准，只有你的是对的，其他的都是naturalwrong（自然错误）。我读施特劳斯的书，经常会感到很可怕。.
商务英语口语大全_百度百科 ... Right.( 对.) Wrong.( 不对（wrong）.) Not exactly.( 未必./不全是.).

大学英语四级常用词组 ... do sb. wrong 冤枉(委屈)某人 go wrong 出错；发生故障 all the years round 一年到头.

jx.jx_en_mean: misunderstand someone, especially by falsely imputing malice

responsible for a quarrel, mistake, or offence
in the opposite of the normal or desirable orientation, direction, or sequence
jx.jx_cn_mean: 方向（或顺序）不对（或不正）地

phrase.cizu_name: two wrongs don't make a right

jx.jx_en_mean: (proverb)the fact that someone has done something unjust or dishonest is no justification for acting in a similar way
jx.jx_cn_mean: (谚)以牙还牙行不通；两个错误不等于一个正确；不能因别人错了自己也就可以犯错

jx.jx_en_mean: To take a wrong turn or make a wrong move.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 走错路，搞不好：拐错弯或采取了错误的行动

jx.jx_en_mean: To go amiss; turn out badly.

means.word_mean: 邪恶的;不健康的
错的;不适当的
其他释义
错误的;反
其他释义

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Old English wrang, from Old Norse rangr 'awry, unjust'; related to wring

encyclopedia.content: 音标 英音：[rɔ:ŋ]美音：[rɔŋ]词典解释 形容词 a. 1. 错误的，不对的[+to-v] I took the wrong way. 我走错了路。 2. 不道德的；犯罪的；邪恶的[F][+to-v] It is wrong of you to bully the child. 你不该欺侮那个孩子。 3. 不正常的，出毛病的；不健全的[F][(+with)] What's wrong with the machine? 这机器出了什么毛病？ Something is wrong with her. 她有问题。 4. 不适当的 She is the

entry.def: If you say there is something wrong, you mean there is something unsatisfactory about the situation, person, or thing you are talking about.

example.ex: Pain is the body's way of telling us that something is wrong...
example.tran: 疼痛是身体在告诉我们有地方出问题了。

example.ex: Nobody seemed to notice anything wrong...
example.tran: 似乎没有人注意到出了问题。

entry.def: If you choose the wrong thing, person, or method, you make a mistake and do not choose the one that you really want.

example.ex: He went to the wrong house...
example.tran: 他去错了房子。

example.ex: The wrong man had been punished...
example.tran: 罚错了人。

entry.tran: (决定、选择、行动等)错误的，不适当的
entry.def: If something such as a decision, choice, or action is the wrong one, it is not the best or most suitable one.

example.ex: I really made the wrong decision there...
example.tran: 在那点上我的决定确实错了。

example.ex: The wrong choice of club might limit your chances of success...
example.tran: 选错俱乐部也许会限制你成功的机会。

entry.tran: 不正确的;与事实不符的
entry.def: If something is wrong, it is incorrect and not in accordance with the facts.

example.ex: How do you know that this explanation is wrong?...
example.tran: 你怎么知道这个解释是错误的呢？

example.ex: 20 per cent of the calculations are wrong.
example.tran: 这些计算有20%是错误的。

entry.tran: （机器设备）出毛病的，出故障的
entry.def: If something is wrong or goes wrong with a machine or piece of equipment, it stops working properly.

example.ex: We think there's something wrong with the computer...
example.tran: 我们认为计算机出了故障。

example.ex: Something must have gone wrong with the satellite link.
example.tran: 卫星连接一定出了毛病。

entry.def: If you are wrong about something, what you say or think about it is not correct.

example.ex: I was wrong about it being a casual meeting...
example.tran: 我误以为这是个非正式会议。

example.ex: Am I wrong in thinking that?...
example.tran: 我这么想错了吗？

entry.tran: (通常用于生气时)你想错了／你听错了
entry.def: You can use wrong in expressions such as you thought wrong and you heard wrong to tell someone that what they thought or were told is incorrect, usually when you are annoyed.

example.ex: 'I thought you and I were going to spend the night together,' he whispered. 'You thought wrong,' Nancy whispered back.
example.tran: “我以为我和你要一起过夜呢。”他小声说。“你想错了。”南茜小声回应道。

entry.def: If you think that someone was wrong to do something, you think that they should not have done it because it was bad or immoral.

example.ex: She was wrong to leave her child alone...
example.tran: 她不该把孩子单独留在那儿。

example.ex: We don't consider we did anything wrong.
example.tran: 我们认为我们没有做错什么。

entry.tran: (活动或行动)不道德的，不可取的
entry.def: Wrong is used to refer to activities or actions that are considered to be morally bad and unacceptable.

example.ex: Is it wrong to try to save the life of someone you love?...
example.tran: 尽力挽救所爱之人的生命难道错了吗？

example.ex: It is wrong that we have to tell ill people to go somewhere else to look for treatment...
example.tran: 我们不得不让病人到别处求医的做法是不可取的。

entry.tran: 不公平行为;不道德行为
entry.def: A wrong is an unfair or immoral action.

example.ex: I intend to right that wrong...
example.tran: 我打算纠正那个错误。

example.ex: The insurance company should not be held liable for the wrongs of one of its agents.
example.tran: 保险公司不应该为其中一名保险代理所犯的错误负责。

entry.def: If someone wrongs you, they treat you in an unfair way.

example.ex: You have wronged my mother...
example.tran: 你冤枉了我妈妈。

example.ex: She felt she'd been wronged...
example.tran: 她觉得受委屈了。

entry.tran: 不能被社会所接受的;不可取的
entry.def: You use wrong to describe something which is not thought to be socially acceptable or desirable.

example.ex: If you went to the wrong school, you won't get the job...
example.tran: 如果你进错了学校，就得不到这份工作。

example.ex: The prospect of easy profits has attracted the wrong kind of businessman.
example.tran: 轻松捞取利润的可能性吸引了一拨不良商人。

entry.def: You say 'Don't get me wrong' when you want to make sure that someone does not get an incorrect idea about what you are doing or saying, or about why you are doing or saying it.

example.ex: Don't get me wrong, it's interesting work. But it's not permanent...
example.tran: 别误会我的意思，这个工作很有意思，可惜不是长期性的。

example.ex: I mean, don't get me wrong. Joanie's my best friend, but she can be kind of a pain sometimes.
example.tran: 别误会，我的意思是乔安妮是我最好的朋友，但她有时候可能有点儿招人烦。

entry.def: If a situation goes wrong, it stops progressing in the way that you expected or intended, and becomes much worse.

example.ex: It all went horribly wrong...
example.tran: 情况完全变得一团糟。

example.ex: Nearly everything that could go wrong has gone wrong.
example.tran: 差不多可能出乱子的地方都出了乱子。

entry.def: If someone who is involved in an argument or dispute has behaved in a way which is morally or legally wrong, you can say that they are in the wrong .

example.ex: He didn't press charges because he was in the wrong...
example.tran: 他没有起诉，因为过错在他。

example.ex: She was the one in the wrong.
example.tran: 她是有过错的一方。

entry.def: If someone says 'Two wrongs don't make a right', they mean that you should not do harm to a person who has done harm to you, even if you think that person deserves it.

means.word_mean: 1. that which is contrary to the principles of justice or law;

sentences.sentence: "he feels that you are in the wrong"

means.word_mean: 2. a legal injury is any damage resulting from a violation of a legal right
1. treat unjustly; do wrong to
1. not correct; not in conformity with fact or truth;

sentences.sentence: "the report in the paper is wrong"

means.word_mean: 2. contrary to conscience or morality or law;

sentences.sentence: "it is wrong for the rich to take advantage of the poor"

means.word_mean: 3. not appropriate for a purpose or occasion;
4. not functioning properly;
5. not according with the facts;
6. based on or acting or judging in error;

sentences.sentence: "it is wrong to think that way"

means.word_mean: 7. not in accord with established usage or procedure;
8. not conforming with accepted standards of propriety or taste; undesirable;

sentences.sentence: "she was seen in all the wrong places"
"He thought it was wrong for her to go out to work"

means.word_mean: 9. used of the side of cloth or clothing intended to face inward;
10. badly timed;

sentences.sentence: "it was the wrong moment for a joke"

means.word_mean: 1. in an incorrect manner;

list.explanation: (黑社会用语)不可信任的人，不光明正大的人，堕落者

example.en: How could I ever have trusted that wrong gee?
example.zh: 我怎么会信任那么个不光明磊落的人的呀？

auth_sentence.content: Confusion may be the only clue something is wrong.
auth_sentence.res_content: Confusion may be the only clue something is wrong.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Confusion may be the only clue something is wrong.

auth_sentence.content: It is wrong to have left the deaf behind.
auth_sentence.res_content: It is wrong to have left the deaf behind.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It is wrong to have left the deaf behind.

auth_sentence.content: With credentials like that, nothing can go wrong.
auth_sentence.res_content: With credentials like that, nothing can go wrong.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: With credentials like that, nothing can go wrong.

Sentence.sentence: They are based on wrong assumptions.
The man found himself in a wrong place.
D )it had been parked at a wrong place
Oprah Winfrey's honorary doctorate was a step in the wrong direction.
Something went wrong with her car
What's wrong with your phone, Gary?

means.word_mean: 不道德的, 不正当的, 不义的，不诚实的

sentences.en: You are quite wrong in doing this.
sentences.cn: 你做这件事是不应该的。

sentences.en: You were wrong to take the car without permission.
sentences.cn: 你未经许可就把车开走是不应该的。

means.word_mean: 不确实的, 不正确的, 错误的，不对的

sentences.en: You're wrong; she didn't say that.
sentences.cn: 你错了, 她没那么说。

sentences.en: I've been wrong to accuse him.
It was wrong of you to go there.

means.word_mean: 不合要求的, 不适合的, 并非合意的

sentences.en: This is the wrong time to make a visit.
sentences.cn: 这个时间去拜访是不合适的。

sentences.en: I knew something was dreadfully wrong.
sentences.cn: 我知道有些情况极不正常。

means.word_mean: 有故障；引起问题（或麻烦）；有毛病；不正常
罪过, 过失, 罪恶

sentences.en: He doesn't know the difference between right and wrong.

means.word_mean: 不义的行为, 不公正的事

sentences.en: The teacher has done his students a great wrong.
sentences.cn: 这个老师对待他的学生们十分不公正。

sentences.en: The boy complained of the wrongs he had suffered.
sentences.cn: 这男孩申诉他受到的委屈。

jushi.english: That's not at all the correct idea of what our country was like. You've got quite a wrong idea of it.
jushi.chinese: 这完全不是对我们国家过去状况的正确理解,你得到的是个完全错误的认识。

jushi.english: He's the wrong man for the job.
She had given me a wrong address.
